name: vscode-php-codesniffer
description: Brings PHPCS support to VS Code.
author: Christopher Allford

phpCodeSniffer.autoExecutable.markdownDescription: Attempts to find `bin/phpcs` in the file folder and parent directories' vendor folder before falling back to the platform-specific executable.

phpCodeSniffer.exec.linux.markdownDescription: The path to the PHPCS executable we want to use on Linux when `#phpCodeSniffer.autoExecutable#` is disabled or unable to find one.

phpCodeSniffer.exec.osx.markdownDescription: The path to the PHPCS executable we want to use on OSX when `#phpCodeSniffer.autoExecutable#` is disabled or unable to find one.

phpCodeSniffer.exec.windows.markdownDescription: The path to the PHPCS executable we want to use on Windows when `#phpCodeSniffer.autoExecutable#` is disabled or unable to find one.

phpCodeSniffer.exclude.description: Glob patterns for files and folders that should be ignored by the extension.

phpCodeSniffer.lintAction.description: The editor action that will cause the linter to run.
enumDescriptions: Lints whenever a document is changed.
Lints when a document is saved.

phpCodeSniffer.standard.description: The coding standard that should be used by PHPCS.
enumDescriptions: Allows PHPCS to decide the coding standard.
Searches for a coding standard configuration file in the current document's folder and parent directories.
Uses the custom standard referenced in the custom ruleset option.

phpCodeSniffer.standardCustom.markdownDescription: The custom coding standard to use if `#phpCodeSniffer.standard#` is set to 'Custom'.

phpCodeSniffer.executable.markdownDescription: The path to the PHPCS executable we want to use when `#phpCodeSniffer.autoExecutable#` is disabled or unable to find one.
phpCodeSniffer.executable.markdownDeprecationMessage: Executables are now be platform-specific; use `#phpCodeSniffer.exec.linux#`, `#phpCodeSniffer.exec.osx#`, or `#phpCodeSniffer.exec.windows#` instead.

phpCodeSniffer.specialOptions.description: An object of special options for the extension that serve very narrow use-cases.

assetPathOverride.description: Overrides the path to the directory that contains the extension's asset files.

phpCodeSniffer.ignorePatterns.description: An array of regular expressions for paths that should be ignored by the extension.
phpCodeSniffer.ignorePatterns.markdownDeprecationMessage: File and folder exclusions should use glob patterns in `#phpCodeSniffer.exclude#` instead.
